title: Que system
body:
Four suggestions:

a) Everyday and every login, all players have to WIN one single player game vs Robots on Hardest setting (with higher gold & XP earnings so that the game is shorter) before being able be able to join any Co-op or PVP modes.

b) If you are reported as unskilled by at least 3 allies or 1 ally & any number of opponents you have to WIN one single player game vs Robots on Hardest setting before being allowed to rejoin PVP queues.

c) Bonus IP or LP (depending on if you've won in a Ranked or Normal game) based on your team Role which can be selected next to your characters pic when in Champion select (enemy team cannot see what role you select).

* Top lane champions get the bonus for Towers/inhibitors/nexus destroyed or defended (defense includes shielding a tower that is under attack by an enemy player or attacking an enemy player who is attacking your tower.
* Mid lane champions get the bonus for Enemy Kills.
* Jungler get the bonus for killing Wards and Dragon & Baron killing blows.
* ADC get the bonus for CS.
* Support get the bonus for Healing/Shielding an ally under attack from an enemy player, Buffing an ally attacking an enemy player that results in a kill and ward placement throughout game period.

d) And option to create a custom game of any map with friends that enables choosing sides and having incomplete teams. 1v2, 2v3, 4v5, etc.

replies.body: this seems really stupid forcing people to play bots

There are alot of people on boosted accounts & this would put some kind of stop to them ruining the game for players actually working to get their own ranking. Nothing is more frustrating than a plat or gold player doing bronze newbie things all game & resulting in a fed enemy champ.

> this would put some kind of stop to them ruining the game for players actually working to get their own ranking.

No, it wouldn't. You don't have to be high elo to dominate bots, you can do it even if you're in low bronze.

> option to create a custom game of any map with friends that enables choosing sides and having incomplete teams. 1v2, 2v3, 4v5, etc.

When did Rito remove this?
